author: sky.cactus
content: If we hit mid September for The Merge, what is the *fewest* validators we could have (due to exit rate limits)?

author: djrtwo
content:
This is the number of validators that can leave the exit queue per epoch -- https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/beacon-chain.md#get_validator_churn_limit

The value is currently 6 at the active validator set and is a minimum of 4. Active validator set is about 409k. There are about About 225 epochs per day so about 16000 exits (assumed no activations) would happen in about 12 days at the 6 threshold. Then it would step down to the 5 per epoch threshold.

If we assume 60 days until merge, we get a 12 day window of 6 per epoch, then a 48 day window of 5 per epoch
* 409k - 6\*225\*12 = 393k
* 393k - 5\*225\*48 = 339k

so certainly more than 300k active validators at the merge. The above math assumes full exit queue and no new entrants
